p: Despite their health benefits, the use of herbal oils in daily nutrition remains relatively rare and regional. The reason is both the short shelf life and the higher price compared to other vegetable oils. Vegetable fats rich in EFAs are easily oxidized (rancid) [ 37, 38], and their durability is determined by the content of vitamin E (tocopherols and tocotrienols). A treatment that increases the stability (durability) of the vegetable oils is the addition of plant extracts rich in antioxidants. This role is best fulfilled by oily herbal plants and herbs which, apart from essential oils, contain a number of other substances with strong antioxidant properties, including glycosidesâ€“anthocyanins, flavonoids, carotenoids, phenolic acids, and also volatile compounds, catechins and vitamins (C, A, E) [ 39, 40, 41, 42, 43, 44].
